title: cobra_maneuver
body: A flight maneuver in which the aircraft rapidly lifts its nose, creating massive angle of attack and causing rapid deceleration, then recovers without much loss in altitude. It is named for the pilot who was credited with first performing it in a [[Su-27]], Viktor Pugachev, though it is widely understood that the Swedish Air Force had discovered the maneuver much earlier while studying the [[Saab Draken]]. It is also known as the "Cobra Maneuver" or the Swedish Cobra especially when performed in a Draken.

title: project_bunny
body:
[[Honkai (series)|]] sort-of character, tagged under its [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] name, Project Bunny. In [[Benghuai Xueyuan|Guns GirlZ]] it's known as Armored Bunny.

[[Bronya Zaychik]]'s mecha partner in arms utilized for combat. It has the ability to fire cannon shots, concentrated lasers, or cluster missiles. In Honkai Impact 3rd, it takes on a slightly different look depending on which battlesuit Bronya is using. With [[Bronya Zaychik (Wolf's Dawn)|Wolf's Dawn]] Valkyrie form Project Bunny is able to act independently apart from her as its own unit on the field. After Bronya becomes Herrscher of Reason, it becomes able to turn into a [[motorcycle]].

Later down the story in Honkai Impact 3rd, such as in Chapter 36, Project Bunny is given to [[Seele Vollerei]] (post #6181303), and even becomes an obtainable ELF as of version 6.8. This ELF version is voiced by Risa Tsumugi in Japanese.

title: player_na_wa
body:
Korean webnovel about someone isekaied into a video game based on the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]]. The isekai character is [[Soyeon Jin]], but the actual protagonist is named Jeon Ho, a minor bandit leader who follows Soyeon Jin and becomes a major general in her warlord army. It's a 18+ harem story, so many of the leading protagonists of RoTK have been subject to [[genderswap]].

The novel is paywalled and requires login to read.
"First half":[http://www.joara.com/nobless/bookPartList.html?bookCode=1473268]
"Second half":[https://novelpia.com/novel/11516]
"Namu Wiki Page":[https://namu.wiki/w/%ED%94%8C%EB%A0%88%EC%9D%B4%EC%96%B4%EC%99%80%20%EB%82%98]

title: ashiya_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character from [i][[senran kagura new wave|Senran Kagura: New Wave]][/i].

The self-proclaimed disciple of an unidentified God with the cardinal number suffix of 666. She adopts a naughty attitude towards whomever she comes into contact with. For that reason she has few friends. She herself is aware of her attitude and although she is using her full strength to better herself, she fails every time and gets even more aggravated.

She wields three [[chakram]]s, which she deftly uses to cut up her opponents. 

Age:  15
Gender:  Female
Blood Type:  Type-O
School:  Hebijo 1st year
Birthday:  January 14th
Favorite Food:  Dry-cured Ham

Hair Color:  Red
Eye Color:  Purple
Height:  158cm (5'3")
Bust:  92cm (36") (G Cup)
Waist:  58cm (23")
Hips:  90cm (35") 

Her voice actress is Megumi Han, who is known for voicing [[Gon Freecss]] of [i][[Hunter x Hunter]][/i] (2011).

title: miia_(monster_musume)
body:
Main heroine of [i][[Monster Musume No Iru Nichijou]][/i].

A [[lamia]] (snake girl) with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], [[pointy ears]], small [[scales]] on her cheeks and [[large breasts]]. Her most noticeable physical trait is her long, red [[tail|snake tail]]. She's often wearing 'D' [[hairclip]]s on each side of her head (from the front the clips resemble a snake's eyes while her hair acts as the [[fangs]]), which are part of her species' costume.

She is the first to be [[Kurusu Kimihito]]'s ward when the cultural exchange began. She is a sweet, naive and carefree individual, and has a habit of being clingy when she sleeps. She's very ticklish when one holds the very tip of her tail, which is why Kimihito exploits that weakness in order to get out of her grip. She always refers to him as "[b]Darling[/b] ([i]だぁりん Daarin[/i])", even when speaking to others about him.

title: operation_crossroads
body:
Operation Crossroads was a pair of nuclear weapon tests conducted by the United States military at Bikini Atoll in July 1946. The purpose was to investigate the effect of nuclear weapons against warships. The test fleet was largely composed of obsolete and surplus US Navy ships, as well as three surrendered Axis ships. Test Able consisted of a [[nuclear weapon|Mark III]] [[bomb]] dropped from a [[B-29 Superfortress]], while Test Baker consisted of a Mark III bomb detonated underwater. Some of the ships were sunk outright, many were damaged, and almost all were severely radioactively contaminated and had to be scuttled.

Operation Crossroads is sometimes referenced, both in-game and in fan works, by the [[Kantai Collection]] characters who were historically present: [[Nagato (kancolle)|]], [[Nevada (kancolle)|]], [[Prinz Eugen (kancolle)|]], [[Sakawa (kancolle)|]], and [[Saratoga (kancolle)|]].

h4. Test [i]Able[/i] participants
* [[Sakawa (Kancolle)|Saka]][[Sakawa (Azur Lane)|wa]] (sunk)
* [[Independence (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Nevada (Azur Lane)|Neva]][[Nevada (kancolle)|da]] (painted orange as the primary target)
* [[Pensacola (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Salt Lake City (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Saratoga (Kancolle)|Sara]][[Saratoga (Azur Lane)|toga]]
* [[Prinz Eugen (Kancolle)|Prinz]] [[Prinz Eugen (Azur Lane)|Eugen]]
* [[Pennsylvania (Azur Lane)|]]

h4. Test [i]Baker[/i] participants
* [[Saratoga (Kancolle)|Sara]][[Saratoga (Azur Lane)|toga]] (sunk)
* [[Nagato (Kancolle)|Naga]][[Nagato (Azur Lane)|to]] (sunk)
* [[Prinz Eugen (Kancolle)|Prinz]] [[Prinz Eugen (Azur Lane)|Eugen]] (later sank under tow)
* [[Pennsylvania (Azur Lane)|]]

h4. External link
* "Wikipedia: Operation Crossroads":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crossroads]

title: mocopi
body:
A mobile motion capture system developed by [[Sony]]. This system allows for 3D full-body tracking for character avatar (such as [[VRChat]] or a [[virtual youtuber]] model) anywhere by simply wearing six small sensors on the head, hands, feet, and waist with dedicated bands.

Rather (in)famous for its tendency to glitch out when used by various vtubers.

h4. See also

* [[RAYNOS-chan]] - official mascot

title: raynos-chan
body:
RAYNOS-chan is the official mascot character of [[Sony]]’s mobile motion capture system “[[mocopi]]”. She is a Pteranodon-type AI created by Sony’s XR business and has a YouTube channel. On this channel, videos on how to use mocopi and daily videos of RAYNOS-chan are posted.
In addition, there is an official world of mocopi in the social VR “VRChat”, where you can enjoy dancing with RAYNOS-chan. Through these activities, RAYNOS-chan communicates the appeal of mocopi and deepens interaction with users.

h4. External links

* "YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/@raynosbySony
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/raynosbySony

title: flinch
body:
Sudden jerking motion in response to surprise or shock. Usually portrayed as sharp [[motion lines]] popping out of a character's body.

See [[twitching]] for similar motion in response to agitation or stimulation.

h4. See Also
* [[^^^]]
* [[cowering]]

title: dazzi
body: A lightning elemental [[Pal (creature)|]] from [[Palworld]], Dazzi is a [[petite]] feminine humanoid [[floating]] Pal with [[purple skin]] and the lower body is a [[flying nimbus]]. Dazzi has [[white hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style with a [[high ponytail]], [[blunt bangs]] [[hair over eyes|covering eyes]], and a [[small horns|small]] purple [[single horn]] on her head. Wears a [[purple tube top]].

title: tsukudani_norio
body:
Female artist, mangaka, virtual YouTuber. Best known for [[Himegoto]] manga. Established the [[Noripro]] VTuber group, and also streams as virtual youtuber [[Inuyama Tamaki]] and [[Tsukudani Norio (vtuber)|herself]].

Name: 佃煮 のりお (Tsukudani Norio)
Other names: のりお, 青山

title: erma_(hazy_fragrance)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Erma (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'A Sunlit Spring's Bouquet' skin collection from 2023.

She wears a [[black dress]] with a [[red jacket]], a [[fur shawl]], and [[single sock|one sock]] and [[single leg pantyhose|half pantyhose]]. Accompanying her might be a small [[rabbit]], or an [[oversized animal|oversized]] [[crane (animal)|]]. She carries many [[key]]s with her. As it was the [[Year of the Rabbit]] that year, she has [[rabbit ears]].

title: list_of_gym_leaders
body:
[ [[list_of_pokemon_characters|list of Pokémon characters]] ]

This is a list of Gym Leaders in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

h4. Introduced in the games

h5. Kanto Gym Leaders

The first eight Kanto Gym Leaders listed below (from Takeshi/Brock to Sakaki/Giovanni) appear in [i][[pokemon_rgby|RGBY]][/i], [i][[pokemon_frlg|FRLG]][/i], and [i][[pokemon_lgpe|LGPE]][/i].

The Kanto Gym Leaders are mostly the same in [i][[pokemon_gsc|GSC]][/i] and [i][[pokemon_hgss|HGSS]][/i], except Kyou/Koga and Sakaki/Giovanni are replaced by Anzu/Janine and Green/Blue, respectively.

title: in-franchise_crossover
body:
A non-canonical [[crossover]] between characters from the same franchise. For example, two characters from different games in the same series meeting, who never meet in any official media. This can be applicable to in-franchise [[cosplay]]s as well.

h4. See Also
* [[crossover]]
* [[multiple crossover]]

title: jackalman_(thundercats)
body: Character from the [[Thundercats]] series.

title: mk3a1_(scarlet_intoxication)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Mk3A1 (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'A Sunlit Spring's Bouquet' skin collection from 2023.

She wears an [[orange dress|orange]] [[china dress]] with a [[frilled skirt]] and [[white thighhighs]]. A [[robot animal|robot]] [[rabbit]] accompanies her. She may be carrying a [[weapon case]] with many [[sticker]]s on it.

title: mk3a1_(the_art_of_mk3a1_maintenance)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[MK3A1 (girls' frontline)|]]'s second [[official_alternate_costume|skin]] from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of an obtainable reward from the Frontline Protocol 'Beneath The Fading Lights' from 2023.

She wears [[blue overalls]] with a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[orange shirt|orange]] [[crop top]], and a [[cabbie hat]] with a different pair of [[goggles]] [[goggles on headwear|on them]]. In her official art, she's depicted in a [[workshop]] at a [[desk]] with various [[tools]] on the wall.

title: px4_storm_(gilded_allure)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Px4 Storm (girls' frontline)|]]'s fourth skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'A Sunlit Spring's Bouquet' skin collection from 2023 through shop purchase.

She wears an [[asymmetrical clothes|asymmetrical outfit]]- A [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] and a [[single leg pantyhose|single leg]] [[red pantyhose]], a [[white dress|white]] [[china dress]] with a [[single sleeve]], a [[single earring]], and a pair of [[red gloves|red]] [[asymmetrical gloves|and]] [[black gloves]] (Both different in style but both possessing inverted red and black). The only symmetrical part could be her [[fur shawl]] and [[black footwear]].

body:

title: atlantis:_the_lost_empire
body:
A 2001 animated film produced by [[Disney]]. The story centers around the character [[milo james thatch|Milo Thatch]], whose dreams of finding the legendary titular city are realized with the help of an expedition funded by a friend of his late grandfather. His resulting adventure not only leads him to the city, but also to uncover its secrets as well as those of the expedition. 

Though a financial failure, the film would develop something of a cult following as the 2000s and 2010s went on.  Similarities were also noted by some to the events of [[Fushigi no Umi no Nadia|Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water]] that resulted in plagiarism accusations being made, though these never saw the courtroom.
other_names: アトランティス失われた帝国

title: hat_bell
body: Any type of [[bell]], frequently a [[jingle bell]], attached to any type of hat or headwear.

title: the_emperor's_new_groove
body: The Emperor's New Groove is a 2000 American animated fantasy comedy film.

title: purring
body:
A tonal fluttering sound, usually produced by [[cat|felids]]. It varies in loudness and tone among species. 

A [[cat]] can purr in response to [[happy|happiness]], as a coping mechanism for [[worried|stress]], to solicit [[food]] or attention, and to communicate with other [[cat]]s.

title: gumball_machine
body: A [[machine]] that dispenses [[gumball]]s. The [[gumball]]s are traditionally stored in a large [[glass]] [[jar]] above a small [[door]] that lets them out once a [[coin]] is inserted.

title: kneading
body:
Ambiguous tag.

For the [[cat]] behavior, see [[kneading (behavior)]].

For the process of developing [[dough]] with hands, see [[kneading dough]].

For kneading dough with a [[rolling pin]], see [[rolling dough]].

title: dough
body:
A basic dough is made by mixing fluid (water, milk, oil, etc.) with flour and other ingredients to create an elastic substance. Yeast may or may not be added for leavening. This is then formed into various shapes or molds for creating different foods such as breads, desserts, cookies, pies, pizzas, and so forth.

This tag is for dough that has been prepared at the elastic stage, but not made into a proper dish.

h4.See also

* [[cookie cutter]]
* [[cutting board]]
* [[kneading dough]]
* [[rolling dough]]
* [[rolling pin]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: pointy_nose
body: A large, long nose that is distinctive enough to stand out from the rest of one's facial features.

title: rolling_pin
body:
A cylindrical food preparation utensil used to [[rolling dough|shape and flatten dough]]. They come in three popular varieties; rod, roller, and textured.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: kneading_(behavior)
body:
An act of physical stimulation ritually performed by [[cat]]s. Also known as making biscuits.

Not to be confused with [[kneading dough]], where it got its name.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kneading_(cats)

title: kneading_dough
body:
The mechanical process of developing [[dough]].

This tag specifically refers to kneading done with bare hands, for kneading done with a [[rolling pin]], see [[rolling dough]].

title: rolling_dough
body: Kneading or flattening [[dough]] with a [[rolling pin]].

title: goddess_of_whim
body:
A LIGHT-Attribute Fairy Type [[Duel Monster]] with 950 ATK and 700 DEF.
[b] Effect: Once per turn: You can toss a coin and call Heads or Tails. If you call it right, double this card's ATK during this turn. If you call it wrong, halve its ATK during this turn.[/b]

h4. Appearance
She has [[long hair|long]] [[leaf hair|leafy]] [[green hair]] and a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[aqua dress]] which shows off her [[cleavage]].

title: idol_clothes
body:
Clothes worn by [[idol]]s for performances, particularly common in j-pop. These are usually [[frilled dress|frilly dresses]] for female idols and dapper [[suit|suits]] with accessories for male idols, and are often impractical for being worn outside of performance events.

Group idols' clothes often match each other and create a sense of [[uniform]].

title: grabber_tool
body:
A tool resembling a pole with a claw on the end (usually with two opposed fingers). Pressing a button on the other end closes the claw, acting as a grabber much like a claw crane or a hand. It can be used to extend one's reach and/or fit through tight spaces, when one's arm isn't enough.

A bulky, robot-hand version is sold as a toy for kids, giving kids extra reach but also just because the appearance is more playful, allowing kids to roleplay like a robot or crab. The claw may be large enough to surround an adult's arms.

For more high-performance extending (usually mechanical) hands, see [[nobiiru arm]].

title: ki-100
body:
The [b]Kawasaki Ki-100[/b] (キ100) was a Japanese fighter [[aircraft]] during the Second World War. The [[imperial japanese army|Japanese Army]] designation was "[b]Type 5 Fighter[/b]" (五式戦闘機, Go-shiki sentouki, or abbreviated as Goshikisen). Unlike some other Japanese aircraft, it was not assigned an Allied code name.

It was developed in early 1945 as an emergency measure to convert the [[ki-61 hien|Ki-61]] airframe to accept a 14-cylinder Mitsubishi Ha-112-II radial engine in place of the original Kawasaki Ha-40 inverted V-12 inline engine, due to the factory for the latter being destroyed by the US bombing raid.

h4. See also

* [[Ki-61 Hien]]
* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia (JP): "Kawasaki Ki-100":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%94%E5%BC%8F%E6%88%A6%E9%97%98%E6%A9%9F
* Wikipedia (EN): "Kawasaki Ki-100":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawasaki_Ki-100

title: ki-61_hien
body:
The [b]Kawasaki Ki-61 Hien[/b] (飛燕, "flying swallow") was a Japanese fighter aircraft during the Second World War. The Japanese Army designation was "[b]Army Type 3 Fighter[/b]" (三式戦闘機). Its Allied reporting name was [b]Tony[/b] and the only mass-produced Japanese fighter of the war to use a liquid-cooled inline V engine. The inline engines used were derivatives of the Daimler-Benz DB series (the Ki-61-I variants used the Ha-40, the Japanese version of the DB 601 engine while the Ki-61-II variants used the Ha-140, the Japanese equivalent of the DB 605 engine) and were generally unreliable due to the Japanese Army having lack of experience with inline engines.

Initially armed with two 12.7 x 81 mm Ho-103 machine guns in the fuselage and two 7.7 x 58 mm SR Type 89 machine guns in the wings, it was upgraded to four 12.7 x 81 mm Ho-103 machine guns (the wing machine guns being replaced), two 12.7 x 81 mm Ho-103 machine guns in the fuselage and two MG 151/20 cannons (20 x 82 mm) in the wings and finally to two 20 x 94 mm Ho-5 cannons in the fuselage and two 12.7 x 81 mm Ho-103 machine guns in the wings (the wing machine guns were sometimes removed).

It was designed by Doi Takeo [土井 武夫] and entered combat for first time in early 1943.

h4. See also

* [[Ki-100]]
* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia (JP): "Kawasaki Ki-61 Hien":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%89%E5%BC%8F%E6%88%A6%E9%97%98%E6%A9%9F
* Wikipedia (EN): "Kawasaki Ki-61 Hien":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawasaki_Ki-61

title: aum_shinrikyo
body:
Real life religious cult and terrorist organization. After causing numerous terrorist attacks, most notably the 1995 subway sarin attack in Tokyo, the group was effectively disbanded, with the head guru responsible for the attack, [[Asahara Shoukou]], arrested and later executed.

The remaining holdovers of AUM has since rebranded themselves as Aleph, with another group known as Hikari no Wa (ひかりの輪) sprintering from it.

title: maryland_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Maryland[/i] (BB-46). 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]].

h4. Appearance
In-game, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and a [[large_breasts|well endowed]] yet petite body, much like her sister [i]Colorado[/i]. She wears a yardarm [[headgear]], a two-tone [[grey dress]] with blue accents and a [[sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] that superficially appears [[strapless dress|strapless]], a [[blue necktie]] with her hull number (46) on it, [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] held by [[garter straps]], a grey [[capelet]], and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] is the same as that of her sister's, with all four of her historic 406 mm twin gun mounts, two of her 127 mm open pedestal mounts, a [[smokestack]], and her real-life cage mast with a range clock. Her [[Maryland Kai (Kancolle)|first remodel]] swaps her range clock for an SK [[radar]] mounted atop the mast.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Maryland[/i] was moored inboard of the [i]Oklahoma[/i] at Pearl Harbor on the day of the attack and largely escaped damage while Oklahoma capsized from the bomb and torpedo damage sustained. Several of Oklahoma's sailors assisted Maryland's crew in the attack while Maryland's crew assisted in rescue efforts aboard Oklahoma.

She was among the first battleships from the attack to reenter active service, sortieing with the other available units during the [[battle of Midway]] as a standby force.

She participated in shore bombardment duties in the battles of Tarawa and Saipan before seeing action in the battle of Leyte Gulf against "Nishimura's fleet.":/pools/9549 Later on, she sustained kamikaze damage on the same day as [[Operation Ten-Gou|Operation Ten-go]] (which also explains her being the reward for Spring 2022 E-5, which is based off [i]Ten-Go[/i]), which put her out of action for the rest of the conflict. She was decommissioned in 1947 and scrapped 12 years later.

h4. [i]Colorado[/i]-class battleships
* [[Colorado (Kancolle)]] (BB-45)
* [b]Maryland [/b] (BB-46)

h4. See also
* [[Maryland (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Maryland (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Maryland[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Maryland_(BB-46)]

title: efforia_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]The modern Greek form of "Euphoria". An allusion to his sire's name also being a greek word.[/tn]

Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Katies Heart.

He is a lighter bay horse with no facial markings and a sock on his left hind leg. He is a somewhat larger than normal horse, weighing between 510 and 520 kg in his prime. He typically ran with a shadow roll.

One of the dominant colts of the 2021 Generation, he is the winner of the 2021 [[Satsuki Sho]]. He had a promising start in his carreer by winning the 2021 Autumn Tenno Sho and the 2021 [[Arima Kinen]] but he slumped in 2022 and his carreer ended after being diagnosed with atrial fibrillation in the aftermath of his failed race at the 2023 Kyoto Kinen.

title: senran_kagura_new_link
body:
[b]Shinobi Master: Senran Kagura NEW LINK[/b] ([b]シノビマスター 閃乱カグラ NEW LINK[/b]), officially abbreviated as  [b]ShinoMas[/b] ([b]シノマス[/b]), is a free-to-play collectible [[card_(medium)|card]] RPG for mobile devices. It was released to Android and iOS on November 29, 2017.

The game features each of the four schools from the [[senran kagura shinovi versus|Versus]] games, with more characters being added through periodic updates. Like [[Senran Kagura New Wave]], the gameplay centers around collecting cards, but in addition to the illustrations, each card unlocks a costume for use in [[3D]] turn-based combat.

title: cremation
body:
The disposal of a dead person's body by burning it to [[ashes]], often serving as a [[funeral]] or post-funeral rite. The ashes of the deceased are collected into [[urns]] to later be buried, enshrined, or scattered. In Japan, the urn may sometimes be placed within a [[kotsubako]], a ceremonial box.

Cremation is [https://web.archive.org/web/20160611020232/http://www.effs.eu/cms/fileadmin/members_only/documents/news_articles/Cremation_statistics_2014.pdf](universal in Japan) compared to Western countries, the former from an imitation of the [[Buddha]] and space concerns and the latter traditionally from the Christian belief in the [[resurrection]] of the flesh.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Cremation":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cremation

title: funeral
body:
A service commemorating someone who has passed away, allowing those close to the deceased to say their final farewells. Funerals often have a somber environment since many people have to cope with the reality that the person is gone, all while having to say good-bye to them at the funeral.

h4. See also

* [[burial at sea]]
* [[cremation]]
* [[funeral dress]]
* [[funeral kimono]]
* [[graveyard]]
* [[iei]] (mourning photo)
* [[kotsubako]]
* [[spirit tablet]]
* [[tombstone]]

title: ainz_ooal_gown
body:
The Antho-protagonist from the series [[overlord_(maruyama)|Overlord by Maruyama]].

He is the Evil Overlord ruling the Great Tomb of Nazarick. Ainz, originally called Momonga, is a [[skeleton]] mage called a "[[Lich]]" and one of the most powerful people in the world who, while good with tactics and quick thinking, lacks foresight and often underestimates the behavior of his underlings. This has set the plot in motion that everyone wants to conquer the world for him, something he often worries about. Nicknamed "The Strongest Spellcaster, with the Appearance of a Skeleton" due to the aforementioned reasons.

Ainz also sometimes plays the role of "[[Momon (overlord)|]]", a black knight who fights with two huge swords, often with the purpose of collecting new information by doing undercover missions. Helping him in this endeavor is [[Narberal Gamma]], assuming the name "Nabe" and pretending to be his colleague, rather than servant.
other_names: アインズ・ウール・ゴウン
モモンガ(オーバーロード)

title: mortal_kombat_1_(2023)
body:
The 12th mainline [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] game, and the fourth game in the post-Armageddon rebooted series.

Follows after [[Mortal Kombat 11]], which ended with the creation of a new timeline under Fire God [[Liu Kang]]. Notably alters the origins of several characters, of note being [[Scorpion (Mortal Kombat)|]].

title: big_chungus_(meme)
body:
[b]Big Chungus[/b] refers to an image of the obese [[Bugs Bunny]], usually captioned with the phrase "Big Chungus" and presented as a game for [[PlayStation 4]] console. The image originated from the 1941 [[Looney Tunes]] short [i]"Wabbit Twouble"[/i], showing Bugs mocking [[Elmer Fudd]] (who at the time was depicted as obese) by briefly imitating his appearance.

The word "chungus" was coined by [[video game]] journalist Jim Sterling several years before the meme became popular. Starting in July 2019, the [[meme]] regained ironic popularity on iFunny and certain parts of [[Reddit]], particularly as a part of Reddit Moment memes. The meme's popularity has reached the point that [[Warner Bros]]. has inserted some references to Big Chungus into several media, such as in the mobile game Looney Tunes World of Mayhem and the 2021 film [[Space Jam: A New Legacy]].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Big Chungus":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/big-chungus]

title: bugs_bunny
body:
One of the main characters of [[Looney Tunes]] series, later became the de-facto mascot of [[Warner Bros]].

Bugs is a blue-grey [[personification|anthromorphic]] [[rabbit]] with a sharp and quick-witted personality. Most of the time, Bugs often involved in a feud with the hunter [[Elmer Fudd]] and will usually and comically outsmart him.

He is the originator of the, now near universal, misconception that rabbits like to eat [[carrot]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Big Chungus (meme)|]]

title: dr._slump
body:
A comedy manga and anime written and illustrated by [[Toriyama Akira]], being one of his first serialized works. (In)famous for huge amounts of toilet humor.

It features the adventures of a scientist, [[Norimaki Senbei]] and his robot daughter [[norimaki arale|Arale]].

title: cyberpunk_(series)
body:
A [[science fiction]] franchise originally created by Mike Pondsmith. The "original" [[cyberpunk]] media franchise that, while not the first, is so influential that the entire genre is named after it.

h4. Installments
* Cyberpunk (TTRPG, 1988) - also known as [i]Cyberpunk 2020[/i] and [i]Cyberpunk Red[/i] in later editions.
* [[Cyberpunk 2077]] (video game, 2020)
* [[Cyberpunk Edgerunners]] (anime, 2022)

title: power_pro_kun_pocket
body:
Power Pro-kun Pocket (also known as Pawapoke) is a baseball game/dating sim spinoff of the [[Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu]] series.

Each of the series has various storylines and gal-game-like multiple endings, and there is usually a canon one whose storyline continues on to subsequent games of the series. This series is also well-known for various sci-fi/fantasy storylines and a large number of terrible, depressing endings.

title: chakram
body:
An Indian [[weapon]] in the shape of a circular blade. It can be thrown or used as a melee weapon.

Notable examples include: 
* [[Moriya Suwako]]'s [[Moriya's iron rings|iron rings]] from [[Touhou]]
* [[Tira (soulcalibur)|]]'s various weapons from [[Soulcalibur]]
* [[Axel (kingdom hearts)|]]'s Eternal Flames from [[Kingdom Hearts]]
* [[Dromarch (xenoblade)|]]'s Twin Rings from [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]] (mostly wielded by [[Nia (xenoblade)|]])
* [[Mio (xenoblade)|]]'s Twin Moonblades from [[Xenoblade Chronicles 3]]
* [[Azusa Mifuyu]]'s chakram from [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chakram":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chakram]

title: angel
body:
Spiritual beings usually viewed as messengers and guardians to living beings, typically originated from [[heaven]].

Their appearance varies culturally and characteristically, but the common popular depiction is based on the medieval stylization of a humanoid with [[white wings|white]] [[angel wings]] and a [[halo]].

h4. Notable angel characters

* [[Amane Kanata]] from [[Hololive]]
* [[Angel Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]] from [[Chainsaw Man]]
* [[Azazel (helltaker)|]] from [[Helltaker]]
* [[Cassie (acerailgun)|]], original character by Acerailgun
* [[Crimvael]] from [[Ishuzoku Reviewers]]
* [[Nanael (queen's blade)|]] from [[Queen's Blade]]
* [[Pekora (jashin-chan dropkick)|]] from [[Jashin-chan Dropkick]]
* [[Gabriel Tenma White]], [[Raphiel Shiraha Ainsworth]] and [[Tapris Chisaki Sugarbell]] from [[Gabriel Dropout]]

title: bon_clay
body:
A character from [[One Piece]].

An okama ballet dancer formerly part of the criminal organization [[Baroque Works]], codename Mister 2 Bon Clay.

Possessing the powers of the Mane Mane no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can impersonate somebody's appearance just by touching them. The extent of his powers also allow him to mix and match body parts.

Real name was revealed as [spoiler]Bentham[/spoiler].

title: cyborg_009
body:
[[Science Fiction]] 1960's manga created by [[Ishinomori Shoutarou]] which has adaptations of 3 movies, (2 from 1960s and one from 1980s), 3 anime and 2 CGI anime movies.

The story follows 9 individuals from different countries captured by the evil organization led by the Black Ghost and transformed into [[cyborg]]s in order to be used as [[war]] weapons. however, a kind [[scientist]] named Dr. [[Isaac Gilmore]] free them and so they all, led by [[Shimamura Joe]] (Cyborg 009) fight for justice in an attempt to defeat the Black Skull and prevent a possible war.

h4. Characters

* 001 - [[Ivan Whisky]]
* 002 - [[Jet Link]]
* 003 - [[Francoise Arnoul]]
* 004 - [[Albert Heinrich]]
* 005 - [[Geronimo Jr]]
* 006 - [[Chang Changku]]
* 007 - [[Great Britain (Cyborg 009)|Great Britain]]
* 008 - [[Pyunma]]
* 009 - [[Shimamura Joe|Joe Shimamura]]

body:

In general, use this tag for artworks that reference the class or depict its magical powers, not just the tools or act of painting.

title: science_fiction
body:
A genre of fiction which centers around futuristic science and technology. 

Space travel, [[robot]]s and [[alien]]s, and/or complex [[machine]]ry are common aspects of this genre. Use this tag for images which appear to be set inside of a science fiction universe. 

Scifi and [[fantasy]] often intersect, so feel free to use both tags if you feel it is appropriate.

title: kasukabe_saki
body:
A female character from [[Genshiken]]. 

[b]Kasukabe Saki[/b] is a strong-willed and aggresive down-to-earth, practical, manipulative, and attractive young woman. 

Saki is a somewhat ruthless and easily angered (specially if called [[otaku]]) individual, resorting to physical violence most of the time. She is also a chain smoking person.

[[Madarame Harunobu]] is her nemesis, [spoilers] but Kasukabe ends up becoming one of his best female friends some time later. Saki officially ends up paired with [[Kousaka Makoto]] during the first season of the Genshiken manga series.[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Yukino Satsuki]] in the two original series and OVA productions from Media Blasters, and by [[Satou Rina]] in [[Production IG]]'s Genshiken Nidaime.

title: cowgirl_peach
body: One of [[Princess Peach|Princess Peach's]] transformations in [[Princess Peach: Showtime!]], turning her into a [[cowgirl]]. In this form, she wears a [[blue shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] and an [[open vest|open]] [[brown vest]], along with [[blue shorts|blue]] [[denim shorts]] and [[brown pants|brown]] [[chaps]], along with a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel boots]]. Her ponytail also gets [[low ponytail|lower]], and she wears a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[cowboy hat]] with [[fake horns|fake]] [[cow horns]] on it, along with a [[red scarf]], [[brown gloves]], and a [[brown belt]].

title: ninja_peach
body: One of [[Princess Peach|Princess Peach's]] transformations in [[Princess Peach: Showtime!]], where she becomes a [[ninja]]. In this form, she wears a [[black shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], along with a pair of [[puffy pants|puffy]] [[black pants]], complete with a [[black pantyhose]], a pair of [[black socks]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[zouri]]. Her ponytail also gets [[high ponytail|higher]], and she also wears a [[green scarf]] and [[black arm warmers]].

title: patissiere_peach
body: One of [[Princess Peach|Princess Peach's]] transformations in [[Princess Peach: Showtime!]], where she becomes a pastry chef. In this form, she wears a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[long skirt|long]] [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid skirt]], with a [[petticoat]] and [[white pantyhose]] underneath, complete with a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. Her hairstyle becomes [[braided hair rings]] instead of the usual ponytail, and she also wears a [[chef hat]], a [[pink necktie]], and a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]]. Often seen holding an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[pipette]].

title: detective_peach
body: One of [[Princess Peach|Princess Peach's]] transformations in [[Princess Peach: Showtime!]], where she becomes a [[detective]]. In this form, she wears a [[brown coat|brown]] [[trench coat]] that comes with [[buttons]] and a [[plaid capelet|plaid]] [[brown capelet]], a pair of [[white shorts]] visible underneath, along with a [[white pantyhose]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[knee boots]]. Also wears her hair in a [[plaid headwear|plaid]] [[brown headwear|brown]] [[deerstalker]], and a pair of [[white gloves]]. Often seen holding a [[magnifying glass]].

title: princess_peach_(happi)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]], depicting her in a [[pink coat|pink]] [[happi]]. also comes with a pair of [[white shorts]] underneath, and [[tabi]], her hair up in a [[ponytail]] with a [[pink headband|pink]] [[hachimaki]].

title: princess_peach_(explorer)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]], depicting her as an explorer. Peach wears a [[brown shirt]] (with a [[pink undershirt]] underneath) with [[short sleeves]] and [[brown shorts|matching shorts]], coming with [[pocket|pockets]], a [[buttons|button]], and a [[black belt]] with a [[belt buckle]]. Also wears a pair of [[white gloves]] [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], along with a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[hat]] and a [[brown bag|brown]] [[backpack]] with a [[map]] in it.

body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Mario Kart Tour]], putting her in a [[white kimono|white]] [[yukata]] with a [[heart print]] on it. She also wears a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] [[geta]], as well as a [[Boo (Mario)|Boo]] [[character mask|mask]] [[mask on head|on her head]], her hair also tied up in a [[ponytail]]. Often seen holding an [[uchiwa]].

Not to be confused with her [[Princess Peach (Kimono)|kimono costume]] from the same game.

Depicts her wearing a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[witch hat]] with her usual [[crown]] on top of it, and a short [[purple cape]]. Usually seen holding a [[wand]].

body:

Also wears [[tabi]] and a pair of [[red footwear|red]] [[okobo]], as well as her hair up in a ponytail with a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow|bow]].

body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]], meant for [[winter]]. Peach wears a [[grey coat|grey]] [[winter coat]] with [[buttons]] and a pair of [[black gloves]], as well as a [[grey pantyhose]] and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. Also wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] and a [[white scarf]] with a [[white bow|matching]] [[bow]] on it.

body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]] that can be found when she takes a vacation. Peach wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], matched with a [[long skirt|long]] [[pink skirt]], held in place with a [[pink belt]] and a gem buckle. Along with it, she wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[sun hat]], a [[pink scarf]] and a pair of [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]].

title: princess_peach_(sunshine)
body: The [[official alternate costume]] [[Princess Peach]] wears in [[Super Mario Sunshine]]. In it, she trades her usual pink dress for a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress|white one]], as well as ditches her usual gloves and puts her hair up in a [[ponytail]]. Is often seen holding a [[white umbrella|white]] [[parasol]].

title: princess_peach_(swimwear)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]], putting her in a [[swimsuit]]. She wears a [[pink bikini]], the bottoms concealed by a [[white skirt|white]] [[sarong]] with a [[crescent print]] on it. She also wears a pair of [[white-framed eyewear|white]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on her head]], a pink [[lei]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[sandals]].

title: princess_peach_(wedding)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]]. Depicts her as a complete [[bride]], complete with a [[bridal veil]] and [[white dress|white]] [[wedding dress]]. She also wears a [[tiara]] (actually [[Tiara (Mario)|Tiara]]), a [[white choker]] equipped with her usual brooch, and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

title: tomino_yoshiyuki
body:
[b]Tomino Yoshiyuki[/b] (富野 由悠季, born 富野 喜幸 November 5, 1941) is a notable Japanese [[mecha]] anime story creator and writer, responsible for perhaps making [[gundam|the first real robot anime]]. He created and first introduced the now popular term [[mobile suit]] for that series.

Tomino is also infamous for having some series end with numerous characters dying, earning him the nickname "Kill'em All Tomino"  (皆殺しの富野 [i]Minagoroshi no Tomino[/i]).

He has created or co-created such notable works as the U.C. (Universal Century) [[Gundam]] series that started with [[Mobile Suit Gundam]], [[Zeta Gundam]], [[Gundam ZZ]], [[Victory Gundam]], [[Turn A Gundam]], [[Seisenshi Dunbine]], [[Densetsu Kyojin Ideon]], [[Sentou Mecha Xabungle]], [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]], [[Juusenki L-Gaim]], [[Brain Powered]] and [[Overman King Gainer]] among others. His latest work is [[Gundam G No Reconguista]].

Tomino also writes some of the music for his series under the pseudonym "Iogi Rin":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BA%95%E8%8D%BB%E9%BA%9F], such as King Gainer's catchy opening.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino
* Pixiv tag search: "”富野由悠季 (監督 OR 御大)”":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag&word=%E5%AF%8C%E9%87%8E%E7%94%B1%E6%82%A0%E5%AD%A3%20%28%E7%9B%A3%E7%9D%A3%20OR%20%E5%BE%A1%E5%A4%A7%29

title: karmatron
body:
The eponymous [[super robot]] main character of the [[Karmatron y los Transformables]] [[mexico|Mexican]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] comic series from the 80s.

[b]Karmatron[/b] is a 300 feet tall, red, silver and black armoured spiritual warrior and robotic looking [[mecha]] being who protects good and peace in the universe.

Its name comes from the combination of the word [i]Karma[/i], a mystic word, and the cybernetic term [i]Tron[/i].

Besides its enormous size, Karmatron has also many super powers, including telekinesis, clairvoiyance, energy blasts, astral journeys, flight, space travel, a powerful and almost indestructible armor, a power [[katana]], an ice saber, freezing rays, energy [[boomerang]]s, energy [[shuriken]]s and invisibility.

[spoiler]Karmatron is actually prince [[Zacek]] transformed by the powers of his kalpe-om belt.[/spoiler]

In [[real life]] the character was created by [[Oscar Gonzalez Loyo]] in the 80s.

title: dominion_(manga)
body:
A 1985 [[cyberpunk]] manga written and illustrated by [[Shirow Masamune]]. 

Set in the fictional city of Newport, Japan, in a dystopian future in which infectious diseases as well as air pollution have become so severe that people must wear gas masks when outdoors, the series follows a [[police]] squadron that uses advanced and fast military-style mini-[[tank]]s.

Dominion has been adapted into three original video animation series: the first was released in 1988, the second, [i][[New Dominion Tank Police]][/i] (特捜戦車隊ドミニオン, [i]Tokusō Sensha Tai Dominion[/i]) in 1993, and the third, [i][[Tank Police Team TANK S.W.A.T. 01]][/i] (警察戦車隊TANK S.W.A.T. 01, [i]Keisatsu Sensha Tai TANK S.W.A.T. 01[/i]) in 2006. 

The 1988 OVA is four episodes long and animated by Agent 21, the 1993 OVA is six episodes long and animated by "J.C.Staff":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J.C.Staff, while TANK S.W.A.T. is one episode long and was animated by DOGA Productions using [[3d|CGI]]. 

The manga was published by Hakusensha, Kodansha and later by Seishinsha. It has been published in English by "Dark Horse Comics":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Horse_Comics. 

The anime has been released in English translation in the United Kingdom and Australia by Manga Entertainment and in the United States by Central Park Media, under their U.S. Manga Corps division. The New Dominion Tank Police series was also distributed in the UK, Australia and United States by Manga Entertainment, but later expired. Maiden Japan licensed the six-episode 1993 New Dominion Tank Police OVA series for distribution in North America in 2013.

It is based on the [[Philip K. Dick]] sci-fi novellete [i]"We Can Remember It for You Wholesale":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/We_Can_Remember_It_for_You_Wholesale[/i] first published in The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction in April 1966. 

The film was directed by Paul Verhoeven and written by Ronald Shusett, Dan O'Bannon, Jon Povill, and Gary Goldman.

title: arl-44
body:
The [b]ARL 44[/b] was a French heavy [[tank destroyer]] whose development started just before the end of [[World War II]], after the liberation of [[France]] in 1944.

The ARL-44 bears very distinctive characteristics, with a WWI-style track system (similar to the Churchill) which runs across the whole side of its chassis. This tank is a mix of different inspirations, mainly late war German tank technology such as the [[Panther (tank)]] series or the [[Tiger II]], from which it takes its sloped frontal armour and tall profile. 

Only sixty of these tanks were ever completed, from 1949 onwards. The type proved to be unsatisfactory and was phased out in 1953.

title: bonaparte_(tank)
body:
A fictional heavy armed and armored [[police]] mini-[[tank]] from the [[Dominion (manga)|]] [[cyberpunk]] manga from 1985.

The Bonaparte was built (from the remains of a superior's giant tank she totaled) and piloted by the hot-headed officer [[Leona Ozaki]] and her calm co-pilot [[Al'Cu Ad Solte]].

It was designed by [[Shirow Masamune]] in the 80s. This design influenced the [[Metal Slug]] mini-tank ([[SV001 (Metal Slug)|SV001]]).

title: o/a
body:
A 2009-2012 crude humor comedy manga by [[Watarai Keiji]].  O/A is short for Operation Aurora.

The series revolves around the idol Horiuchi Yutaka and aspiring comedian Tanaka Harumi.  At the start of the series Yutaka gets a gig as the host of a late night radio show once a week.  Due to circumstances, Yutaka ends up unable to host during part of her first show.  Desperate on what to do, the staff realize that the part-timer Harumi sounds just like Yutaka and forces her to host the show in Yutaka's absence.  This coincidence would eventually lead to both girls co-hosting the show while not revealing to the public that there is more than one host.

h4. Characters

title: savage_model_99
body:
A [[lever action]] centerfire [b][[rifle]][/b] designed "Arthur W. Savage":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_William_Savage and sold by his Savage Arms Company, beginning in 1899 (hence the name). It was a development of the earlier Model 1895, and was intended to compete with Winchester's ones, such as the [[Winchester Model 1894]]. Unlike its competitors, the Savage Model 99 used a rotary [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] instead of a tubular one, and had no external hammer. Although Savage's attempts to garner [[military]] contracts for the Model 99 were unsuccessful, it was a popular civilian sporting [[gun|rifle]] and remained in production until 1998.

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Savage 99 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Savage Model 99":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Savage_Model_99

title: natasha_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Natasha[/b] (ナターシャ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]], who is a cleric from the Grado Empire. After discovering the true nature of Emperor [[Vigarde (Fire Emblem)|]], she leaves Grado to warn everyone about this, only to be intercepted by [[Joshua (Fire Emblem)|]], a mercenary hired to kill her. Ironically, after being recruited, she can be used to recruit Joshua into the player’s army as well, and can even marry him if they share an A Support.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] with [[blue eyes]], and a "nice [[smile]]" according to Joshua. She wears a white clerical [[hood]] with a [[white dress]], and is often seen carrying a [[staff]].
other_names: ナターシャ(聖魔の光石)

body:

Poppi can unlock alternate forms which can be switched between during battle:

* [[Poppi Alpha (xenoblade)|]] (Poppi α): Poppi's original, child-like form with a mostly robotic appearance. Has [[short hair]] with [[twintails]] in the back.
* [[Poppi QT (xenoblade)|]] ("Quixotic Tutelar"): Poppi's second form, with a teenage and more human-like appearance. Wears a [[maid]] outfit.
* [spoiler][[Poppi QTPI (xenoblade)|]] ("Quantum Technochampion π"): Poppi's final form, and the most mature in appearance. Wears a [[mecha musume]]-like outfit with a [[highleg leotard]] and has [[long hair]].[/spoiler]

title: rokujouma_no_shinryakusha!?
body:
Light novel series written by Takehaya and illustrated by [[poco_(asahi_age)|Poco]]. 
As a collaborative event, [[Higashihongan Sanae]], [[Nijino Yurika]], [[Kurano Kiriha]] and [[Theiamillis Gre Fortorthe]] are also featured in the Third-Person Shooter MMO [[Cosmic Break]] as playable characters.

Synopsis :

[[Satomi Koutarou]] decided to live on his own when he began high school.

Fortunately, he discovered Room 106 of Corona House, small "rokujouma" (6-tatami apartment), that only cost 5000 yen a month.

Unfortunately, he also discovered that numerous otherworldly and supernatural girls also wanted his room for various reasons of their own, and none of them were about to back down.

As a result, Koutarou and the girls found themselves forced to live together as they tried to settle just who would end up with the room.

title: t-55
body:
Early [[Cold War]] period [[Soviet]] main battle [[tank]]. 

Combined a large [[cannon]], good crew protection, and speed in under 40 tons. Over 100k were produced (including those under licence in various "Warsaw Pact":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Pact countries and [[China]]) making it one of the most produced tanks of all time. 

Fought in numerous wars in the Middle East, Africa, Balkans, and Asia. Currently still in service in front line units in a number of nations, as well as in reserve in more.

title: t-44
body:
Intended successor [[tank]] of the [[T-34]], possessing the same armaments as the [[T-34-85]] with a new and improved hull. 

Entered production but not in great numbers. Further development lead to the [[T-54 (Soviet)]], [[T-55]] series.

title: neo_geo
body:
[b]Neo Geo[/b] (ネオジオ?) is a family of [[video game]] hardware developed by [[SNK]]. 

The brand originated in 1990 with the release of an arcade system, the Neo Geo MVS and its home console counterpart, the Neo Geo AES. Both the arcade system and console were very very powerful for the time and the AES allowed for perfect ports of 2D games released for the arcade MVS with superior colors and sound. 

However, the equally very very high price point for both the console and its games prevented it from directly competing with its contemporaries, the [[Sega Mega Drive]] and [[super_nintendo|Super Nintendo Entertainment System]].

Years later, SNK would release the Neo Geo CD, a more cost effective console with games released on compact discs. The console was met with limited success, due in part to its slow CD-ROM drive. 

In an attempt to compete with increasingly popular 3D games, SNK released the Hyper Neo Geo 64 arcade system in 1997 as the successor to its aging MVS. The system did not fare well and only a few titles were released for it. A planned home console based on the hardware was never released. 

SNK later extended the brand by releasing two handheld consoles, the Neo Geo Pocket and Neo Geo Pocket Color, which briefly competed with Nintendo's Game Boy, Game Boy Color and Game Boy Advance. Soon after their release, SNK encountered various legal and financial issues and the Neo Geo brand was officially discontinued in 2004.

Despite the failure of later Neo Geo hardware, games for the original MVS and AES were very well received. The system spawned several long-running series, including [[The King of Fighters]] and [[Samurai Spirits|Samurai Shodown]]. Later releases like the [[Metal Slug]] games ensured that the hardware had quite a long lifespan. 

Homebrew video games for the system have also been released and the AES system along with its games are popular among collectors, with many AES items still fetching high prices at auction. In 2012, SNK Playmore announced that it was revisiting the brand with a handheld console based on the original AES, under the name [i]Neo Geo X[/i].

title: zaku_ii_s
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV anime show from 1979.

[b]MS-06S Zaku II Commander Type[/b]

The definitive command unit based on the reliable if unimpressive [[Zaku II]] [[mobile suit]]. While being visually almost completely indistinguishable from a standard model, notably only by its Commander [[Radio Antenna]] and extra [[thrusters]] on the feet area, its greatly superior performance was usually what tipped off its enemies - shortly followed by their imminent demise. 

Despite being very common among [[Zeon]]'s ranks, the most famous unit was definitely the [[zaku_ii_s_char_custom|red Zaku II]] piloted by [[Char Aznable]], "the Red Comet", whose piloting skills and prowess created the myth that his suit was capable of moving at three times the speed of a regular [[Zaku]].

It is a fantasy [[knight]] costume, and unlike most of her outfits that were done by her designer [[Takehana Note]], this one was designed by [[momoko (momopoco)|Momoco Haru]].

title: descent_shuttle_horizont
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] form the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]Descent Shuttle Horizont[/b] is a type of human combat [[space shuttle]] designed for [[atmospheric reentry]] operations. The Horizont is the smallest of the ships used by the [[Mars Base (kikou souseiki mospeada)|]] Second and the Jupiter Base Third Earth Reclamation Invasion Fleets and they were painted white and blue. The Horizonts that took part in the Third Invasion Fleet were painted red and dark gray.

The shuttle is also designed to deliver two assault pods attached to its wings. Each assault pod functions as a command post that, once firmly on the ground, opens its hatch and releases [[mospeada (mecha)]] troops to join the ground assault forces. 

Each Horizont also carries a [[Legioss]] [[mecha]] attached to a [[Tread]] on its underside that is released to fight in orbit and escort the Horizont as it lands on the planet.

title: kikou_souseiki_mospeada
body:
[b]Kikou Souseiki Mospeada[/b] (機甲創世記モスピーダ lit. [b]Armored Genesis Mospeada[/b], known in English as [i][b]Genesis Climber Mospeada[/b][/i]) is a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime TV series created by Aramaki Shinji and Kakinuma Hideki. It is the first series of the [[MOSPEADA]] franchise.

The 25-episode television series ran from late 1983 to early 1984 in Japan. The show is set in the year 2083, when the Earth faces an alien occupation that has lasted 33 years.

[[Mospeada (mecha)]] stands for "[b]M[/b]ilitary [b]O[/b]peration [b]S[/b]oldier [b]P[/b]rotection [b]E[/b]mergency [b]A[/b]viation [b]D[/b]ive [b]A[/b]rmor", one of the transformable [[motorcycle]]-[[power armor]]s the series features. 

The other primary mecha featured in the show are the three-form transformable fighter called the Armo-Fighter AFC-01 [[Legioss]] and another three form heavy mecha called AB-01 [[Tread]].

All the human and alien mechanical designs for the series were created by [[Aramaki Shinji]] and [[Kakinuma Hideki]] respectively.

Mospeada became [b][i]The New Generation[/i][/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation of the series.

h4. Characters
* [[Stick Bernard]]

* [[Houquet Et Rose]]

h4. See also

title: cosmos_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] [[science fiction]] franchise.

[b]Cosmos[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a [[flying saucer]].

In Japan his name was changed to [b]Adams[/b] (アダムス [i]Adamusu[/i]), a reference to "George Adamski":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski, a person who allegedly photographed a [[UFO]] with a design identical to Cosmos' alternate mode in December 13, 1952.

[quote]Motto: [i]"Reach for the stars, but never leave your friends...!!!".[/i][/quote]

Their [[pointy ears]] are also very long, a common trait of Warcraft elves in general.

title: sniper_team
body:
A [[military]] unit consisting of two or more people. At minimum there is the sniper who is responsible for taking out targets, and the Spotter who relays information on the target (distance, wind speed and direction,  etc.) to the sniper. Additional members includes different snipers for short, medium, and long range targets, Flankers who are assigned to protect the team while it is in position, and Coordinators who helps the team communicate with different teams. 

A sniper team can also be made up of special forces [[military operator|operatives]].

title: retort
body:
A device used for distillation or dry distillation of substances. It consists of a spherical vessel with a long downward-pointing neck. 

The liquid to be distilled is placed in the vessel and heated. The neck acts as a condenser, allowing the vapors to condense and flow along the neck to a collection vessel placed underneath.

title: mall

When referring to a location, a [[mall]] is a large [[indoors|indoor]] [[shopping]] center, usually anchored by department [[shop|stores]]. 

The term [[mall]] originally meant a pedestrian promenade with [[shop|shops]] along it, but in the late 1960s, it began to be used as a generic term for the large enclosed [[shop|shopping]] centers that were becoming increasingly commonplace.

title: arabia
body:
The [b]Arabian Peninsula[/b] (Arabic: شبه الجزيرة العربية‎ shibh al-jazīrat al-ʻarabīyah or جزيرة العرب jazīrat al-ʻArab) is a land mass situated north-east of [[Africa]]. Also known as [b]Arabia[/b] or the [b]Arabian Subcontinent[/b], it is the world's largest peninsula and covers 3,237,500 km2 (1,250,000 mi2).

The area is an important part of the Asian continent and plays a critical geopolitical role of the Middle East and Arab World due to its vast reserves of oil and natural gas. 

The peninsula formed as a result of the rifting of the Red Sea between 56 and 23 million years ago, and is bordered by the Red Sea to the west, the Persian Gulf to the northeast, and the Indian Ocean to the southeast.

title: marseille
body:
Marseille is the prefecture of the French department of Bouches-du-Rhône and capital of the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region. Situated in the camargue region of southern France, it is located on the coast of the Gulf of Lion, part of the Mediterranean Sea, near the mouth of the Rhône river. Its inhabitants are called Marseillais.

Marseille is the second most populous city in France, with 870,731 inhabitants in 2019 (Jan. census) over a municipal territory of 241 km2 (93 sq mi). Together with its suburbs and exurbs, the Marseille metropolitan area, which extends over 3,972 km2 (1,534 sq mi), had a population of 1,873,270 at the Jan. 2019 census, the third most populated in France after those of Paris and Lyon. The cities of Marseille, Aix-en-Provence, and 90 suburban municipalities have formed since 2016 the Aix-Marseille-Provence Metropolis, an indirectly elected metropolitan authority now in charge of wider metropolitan issues, with a population of 1,898,561 at the Jan. 2019 census.

Founded around 600 BC by Greek settlers from Phocaea, Marseille is the oldest city in [[France]], as well as one of Europe's oldest continuously inhabited settlements. It was known to the ancient Greeks as Massalia and to Romans as Massilia. Marseille has been a trading port since ancient times. In particular, it experienced a considerable commercial boom during the colonial period and especially during the 19th century, becoming a prosperous industrial and trading city. Nowadays the Old Port still lies at the heart of the city where the manufacturing of soap, its famous savon de Marseille, began some 6 centuries ago. Overlooking the port is the Basilica of Notre-Dame-de-la-Garde or "Bonne-mère" for the people of Marseille, a Romano-Byzantine church and the symbol of the city. Inherited from this past, the Grand Port Maritime de Marseille (GPMM) and the maritime economy are major poles of regional and national activity and Marseille remains the first French port, the second Mediterranean port and the fifth European port. Since its origins, Marseille's openness to the Mediterranean Sea has made it a cosmopolitan city marked by cultural and economic exchanges with Southern Europe, the Middle East, North Africa and Asia. In Europe, the city has the third largest Jewish community after [[London]] and [[Paris]].

h4. Landmarks
* [[Notre Dame de la Garde]]
* [[Vieux-Port de Marseille]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marseille

title: satan_(devilman)
body:
[[Devilman]] character.

[spoilers][[Asuka Ryou]]'s true identity. Hermaphrodite. 
He and his army of demons hibernated for two million years after a battle against God, only to find out that human beings had taken over Earth in the meantime. To infiltrate their society and understand them more, Satan got his memories replaced with the ones belonging to a recently deceased human - a young man named Asuka Ryou. During his human life as Ryou, Satan met [[Fudou Akira]] and became his best friend, later encouraging him to become a devilman to protect humanity from demons.

Only after demons officially declared war against humans, he got his memory back. Despite having developed romantic feelings for Akira, Satan led his army until the end, wiping out humanity.[/spoilers]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/飛鳥了]

title: help:user_settings
body:
Description "user settings":/settings.

h4. Basic Settings

* [b]Name[/b]
** Requests a username change
* [b]Password[/b]
** Changes the user password
* [b]Email[/b]
** Changes the email address
* [b]Theme[/b]
** Chooses the site's color scheme
* [b]Safe mode[/b]
** [b]True[/b] - The same as using "Donmai.moe":[https://donmai.moe]. In addition to hiding non-{{rating:general}} posts, [u]censored tags[/u] will also be hidden for all member levels ([[Help:Censored Tags]]).
** [b]False[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - All images will be displayed except for [u]censored tags[/u] for certain member levels.
* [b]Posts per page[/b]
** Sets the max number of posts shown on a single page
* [b]Default image width[/b]
** [b]Original[/b] - Will always show the full-size image
** [b]850px[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - Will show the sample image with a max width of 850 pixels
* [b]Receive email notifications[/b] 
** [b]True[/b] - Receive an email when you get a new Dmail
** [b]False[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - No emails will be sent
* [b]Timezone[/b]
** Sets how timestamps are displayed
** Affects how the [code]date:[/code] metatag works ("Help:Cheatsheet":[/wiki_pages/43049#dtext-n2-2-2])
** Default is Eastern Time (US & Canada)
* [b]Comment threshold[/b]
** Comments below this score will be hidden by default
* [b]Blacklisted tags[/b]
** Put any tag combinations you never want to see here
** Each combination should go on a separate line
** You can also whitelist tags by adding a minus sign "-" in front
** See [[Help:Blacklists]] for more information

h4. Advanced Settings

* [b]Account[/b]
** Permanent deactivate your account
[tn]...and other various settings (with description).[/tn]

title: ogre
body:
A general group of large and aggressive humanoid [[monster]]. They are often depicted with a large head, abundant hair and beard, a voracious appetite, and a strong body.

As they are commonly mistaken for [[orc]] due to naming similarity and similar characteristics, later depiction of ogres usually have a [[colored skin]] (typically brown or red, similar to [[oni]], albeit some artist is still using green skin, however), a [[horns|horn]](s), as well as usually being [[fat]] instead of [[muscular]].

Note that this tag is used specifically for the "western" ogres (human-like ogres and derivatives). For Japanese ogres, uses [[oni]] instead.

For the [[Tekken]] character, see [[Ogre (Tekken)]].

title: pancor_jackhammer
body:
The [b]Pancor Jackhammer[/b] is a 12-gauge [[bullpup]] automatic [b][[shotgun]][/b]. Designed in 1984 by John A. Anderson, who formed the company Pancor Industries in New Mexico, [[united states|USA]]. Patented in 1987. Despite not being successful, the weapon is frequently featured in some films, television shows as well as [[video game]]s due to its distinct futuristic appearance.

The unconventional mechanism of Pancor Jackhammer can best be described as a gas-operated [[revolver]]. Layout consisted of a bullpup configuration with a detachable 10-[[shotgun shell|round]] revolving cylinder. The cylinder's method of rotation was very similar to the [[Webley-Fosbery Automatic Revolver]], an operating rod being used to rotate the cylinder, although [b]gas-operated[/b] as opposed to the recoil operation of the Webley-Fosbery. 

h1. See also
* [[combat shotgun]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[MK3A1 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Pancor Jackhammer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pancor_Jackhammer]
other_names: パンコアジャックハンマー

title: inglourious_basterds
body:
A 2009 alternate history war film written and directed by [b][[Quentin Tarantino]][/b], starring [[Brad Pitt]], [[Christoph Waltz]], and [[Michael Fassbender]] among others. It follows the story of a Jewish [[united states army|U.S Army squad]] known as "The Basterds" and a Jewish French [[movie theater|cinema]] owner’s overlapping plans to assassinate the [[Nazi]] high command.

It was Tarantino's sixth main film and generally received positive reviews, many of them praising Christoph Waltz's performance as the main villain, SS Colonel [[Hans Landa]]. It was also Christoph Waltz's debut as a mainstream Hollywood actor.
other_names: イングロリアス・バスターズ

title: tsubomi_(kamioka_shun'ya)
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Kamioka Shun'ya]].

She has [[brown eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[low twintails]] held with [[red ribbon]]s, and [[small breasts]].

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[brown cardigan]], [[white shirt]], [[red bow]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black thighhighs]].

Outside of school, she wears a [[long sleeves|long sleeve]] [[white shirt]] and [[black skirt]].

She is also acquainted with [[Marin (kamioka shun'ya)|]], [[shirasagi sakura|Sakura]], [[Tanaka (kamioka shun'ya)|]], and [[Shiori (kamioka shun'ya)|]].

She has no sight in her right eye and her right horn is [[broken horn|broken]]. She often wears a blade-like [[prosthesis|prosthetic horn]]. (See post #1203121)

title: t-70_x-wing
body:
A fictional spacecraft from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction franchise, first appearing in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015.

The [i]Incom Corporation[/i] [b]T-70 X-Wing[/b] [[Starfighter]] is a newer variation of the old [[T-65 X-Wing]] and shares the same role and shape of the classic ship, being even faster, better armed and armored -as well as more maneuverable- than its predecessor.

The design of this new X-Wing strongly resembles the early concept designs by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie for the first X-Wing in the [[Star Wars: A New Hope|Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope]] film from 1977.

title: neon_palette
body:
A palette predominated by bright, saturated, [[shiny]] and even [[glowing]] colors with an overall cool tone. [[pink theme|Pink]], [[purple theme|purple]], [[blue theme|blue]] and [[aqua theme|aqua]] are the most common and iconic colors, but other colors such as red, green and yellow may be used as well.

Often associated with electronic, digital and mild futuristic themes such as [[arcade]], [[cyberpunk]], [[cityscape]], [[city lights]], [[vaporwave]], [[video game]]s, [[glitch]]es, [[nightclub]]s and their [[bar (place)|]]s, certain types of [[concert]]s etc.

title: salute
body:
A gesture of greeting and respect, typically a hand raised in the air.

h6. Salute Tags

* [[straight-arm salute]]
* [[two-finger salute]]
* [[vulcan salute]]

h6. Official national forms vary from country to country:

* American: forearm at 45° angle to the forehead, blade hand with palm towards face.
* British: similar to American, but with palm facing outward.
* Straight-arm salute (also called Roman, Hitler or Nazi salute and was used by fascist or Nazi movements and governments, most notably Nazi Germany): straight arm extended forward and upwards.

h6. Stylized forms appear in many [[magical girl]] titles:

* [[Sailor Moon]] in particular popularized the "V" hand held sideways, partially framing the eye. This was later inherited by [[Asamiya Athena]] from [[the King of Fighters '96|KOF 96]] onwards
* In [[Final Fantasy VIII]], [[Rinoa Heartilly]] gestures with an upward pointing index finger.

h6. Other well-known forms:

* [[palm-fist greeting|Kung fu]]: a closed fist wrapped in an open palm, often with a slight bow
* Peace/Victory: outward palm with index and middle finger extended, arm extended forward
* Love: opposing thumbs and index fingers join at the fingertips in the shape of a heart; other fingers may suggest wings
